page.title: 16YOUNG SCIENTISTS AT IBSTOCK
page.content: {Ibstock Junior School}responded well to the Government's wishes for more science in schools by winning a county-wide science competition. The contest was designed to stimulate the interest of youngsters in science and to see what sort of work was going on in Leicestershire schools. The Ibstock children embarked on a project about the structure of the earth, minerals, rocks, fossils and soil. Part of the work was to set up simple experiments to show how different rock formations came into being. The work took half a term to complete and the Ibstock display at the county competition won Â£100 worth of science equipment for the school.
